text:
Raskolnikov snatched up her bundle. He dropped it again. Fear consumed him. 

He wanted to flee. 

He felt horror at what he had done. 

He glanced into the kitchen. A bucket sat half full of water. 

His hands were sticky with blood. 

He dropped the axe into the bucket. 

“Just wash it,” he thought. 

He grabbed a piece of soap. 

He scrubbed his hands clean. 

Then he washed the axe blade. 

He spent a long time on the wood.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, overwhelmed by fear and loathing after committing a second murder, struggles with the horror of his actions while attempting to clean himself and the murder weapon.
